reviews.review_msg: Dr. Fernando is the sweetest and most caring professor I've ever had, her lectures are informative but fun to listen to. She also really cares about her students and makes an effort to learn their names, would highly recommend!

Mala's course is really hard. There's a lot of information. But she's very funny and fair. I liked going to her office hours because she'd provide hints on specific parts that might be tested. Studying is a must and attendance in labs and lectures are required. But hey, I much prefer a nice, organized professor than a poor one.
Just like another mediocre instructor. Show up and pass. (However, the lab provided by another instructor contains tons of attendance and pre-works, not very pleasant experience.)

This class was heavy in terms of material. But if you really try in labs, try to keep up with the class, and do the projects you will do well. Dr. Fernando gives so many bonus marks, and she's so kind and helpful to her students. She's really my favourite prof at SFU. If you skip class you won't do well. Even if it gets overwhelming, don't skip.

This class was difficult and you really had to put the effort in but she's always willing to answer questions. Her lectures are detailed and informative. I almost failed both the lecture and lab midterms but still got a solid grade in the class by reading the lectures and asking for help.
You need to do a lot of self teaching.
Shes alright.
She's really nice and wants you to learn but her tests are HARD. If you're looking to boost your GPA it's not gonna happen with her class.
You need to put in the effort but not a bad prof overall.

Mala is very friendly. She is 100% approachable all the time. However she isn't the best at lecturing. Her lectures are all over the place and aren't very cohesive. The positive side of this is that the exams are based on the lecture slides. The lab sucks, it's hard and the midterm average was 50%. Make up the marks during the lecture part. GL!

Mala is one of my favourite profs, but this course was hard. The amount of information is overwhelming and Mala sometimes wants specific answers that you can't always predict. Textbook helped at lot to bring everything from the lectures together. Labs were fun, but lab exams were intense. You need more time than usual to dedicate to this course.
Gives extremely hard exams

Really good prof! talks a lot during labs but really cares about the subject and her students. I would recommend taking her absolutely! It will be hard, but it's biology so it's going to be a little work heavy no matter what

Mala is one of the best profs at sfu. She truly cares about her students and will explain concepts clearly during her office hours. READ AND REREAD her lecture slides for the quizzes. Overall if you try you have nothing to worry about. the labs were kind of tedious, but the lectures were not bad. Mala has a good sense of humor.

She is one of my favorite prof in SFU. She is kind, thoughtful, and really cares students a lot. Going to her office hour really helps a lot so be sure to go to her office hour !! She wants her students to do well and be interest in plants. Although there are a lot of things to do, you will be enjoying it :) Textbook is definitely required.

It is easy to get a good mark if you put any sort of effort in. Lowish grades come from  people who don't know what meiosis is (witnessed on someone's quiz)! Her verbal explanations can be disorganized - but it's easy to put it together as she provides SO much material in lab and her lecture slides just for you to understand basic concepts.

Took BISC337(Plant Bio) with Mala. There was no cohesiveness in lectures, and ended up making everything really confusing. Would refrain from explaining key concepts because we'd be "studying them more later", but when said "later" came, would skip it over as we'd already gone over it .
Mala is one of the best Profs I've ever had She is though let students to think critically is very helpfu. Very inspirational Love to take more classes from her

I found Mala to be a dedicated and inspiring instructor. She cares about how students learn and explores different ways of teaching. While she would run into technical issues frequently, her lectures were engaging and I looked forward to them! I had zero problems with her accent. If you don't pay attention and you don't work hard, you'll struggle.

I just took BISC 100 with Mala. She's a nice person, she's approachable, and she seems to have a positive attitude most of the time. However SFU doesn't pay her to be a nice person. I would say she is not a good prof. She made simple topics confusing, she was unorganized, and she did a horrible job at preparing us for the exams.
Very interesting bit hard to follow her accent but very friendly. Great one to one so use her office hrs or reviews. Very funny and friendly.

She has a pretty heavy accent however if you attend the lectures and listen to the podcast it is easy to follow. Very helpful. Never leave the lab. If things are unclear in the lecture always can ask at the lecture or office hrs. Gives reviews for labs and lecture. Those are very helpful. I'd take another class with her for sure.

Best biology prof I've ever had at SFU. Makes sure that everyone knows what's important and what's not. Reiterates things to help us memorize things easier. Easily approachable and will make sure you understand the concept. Tries to make class fun and encourages people to think instead of regurgitating. Inspired me to transfer into forestry.

Avoid at all costs if you can.  If not, rely on the textbook and go to class... but don't expect her to explain anything well.  She's helpful in lab and I would recommend her help over the TAs as she is the one making exams.  A TONNE of work.

Mala has definitely been an inspiration! She is just so passionate about what she does, and that motivated me! She has an accent that might make the lecture harder to understand, but her helpfulness and passion make up for that! Definitely one of the best professors I've ever had! Highly recommend her class!

The best prof I have had at SFU by far. She is very knowledgable and passionate in the field of biology with a great sense of humour. Her exams are very true to the textbook material and you will get a lot out of her lectures. The difficult of the course is not hard but not easy. A+ quality PHD prof, take her if you to get the most out of bio.

Dr Fernando is by far the most helpful prof that I've had at SFU. She tells you how to answer biology questions intelligently, focuses on conceptual learning, and how to achieve success in the sciences. Plant Bio is a 4 credit course and requires a lot of work,however, if you like plants and work hard. You will excel!

Worst instructor I've had at SFU. Horribly disorganized, rude when students are confused, and the whole course is focused on memorizing reference material. I have an A average and worked twice as hard as normal for a B.

I really do not recommend taking a class with Mala. She is lovely and passionate but as a teacher... difficult, complicated, disorganized, confusing, & demanding. I love plant bio but I have often regretted taking it with Mala.   If you want to succeed be prepared to work extremely hard.  Go to class, read the textbook & manual, you might be okay.

She is so.... cool.Yes hard to understand sometimes but if you listen to the lecture recordings it is easy to follow.Very helpful if you go to her office hours. Also use all thos elab reviews and lect reviews.
Interesting and funny, made biology interesting, lectures are informative.

She is the sweetest person ever! She is... and Cesar as T.A is the best ever. Makes you understand and complete the knowledge that you couldn't get in class.. her accent is a little heavy but she is the sweetest. Kind of unclear the material in class but overall, very interesting class.

If you attend the lectures and the labs it is quite easy to obtain a B+ and above. She is very helpful and if you use her office hrs even the better. Lots of material covered. Made me like plants a lot after taking this course. I learned that plants are really cool orgamisms.

If you attend the lectures and labs you can easily get more than average for your lab and lecture exams. Made me take more Plant Biology related classes. Planning to take her BISC 326 class in the Fall. She posted all the complete power point lectures before the finals. It was very helpful. Labs and Lectures are so much in sync.

She is very hard to understand in class, you spend the majority of class time trying to fill in the blanks rather than being able to understand what it is that she is saying. She is rude and unresponsive in emails. Helpful in the lab, but I found that she isn't very clear when it comes to explaining anything. I would not take class with her again.

Her accent is a bit heavy and it might be hard to understand her lectures but her notes are crystal clear. Lecture exams were on the easy side, lab exams were harder. Nothing unexpected as long as you study consistently. She's also a VERY nice person who cares about her students, doesn't like emails very much though.

Her class provides a good learning environment, and she is extremely helpful, and if she is unclear, the TAs can help. She is very committed to her career, and loves what she does, and loves teaching. I sometimes use her as a fashion role model. In addition, her labs are good for learning. She has inspired me to become a biologist.
Stop whining and listen to her she tries to keep up with international standards. Very helpful and make us be more aware of nature after taking her courses.
She is a very nice lady...she is sometimes hard to understand!!! i recommend her she scales the course very high. I had a C+ and i got a B

Very sweet lady and very interested in teaching biology. Her accent is REALY hard to understand at times & often she would do experiments in lab but not everyone could see. Emails impossible. she responds briefly, unhelpful, & is annoyed that she had to email u. Dont take her for lecture but 4 lab ask LOTS and LOTS of questions and shes alright.
She is really nice. I had her for lab, she really loves what she does. Sometimes her accent is a little hard to understand... but she is easy to talk to and answers questions.

One onf the best lecturer ever, she is very helpful and she is full of knowledge, her slides were organized neatly, easy to understand. The TA would be very helpful if you have problem understanding her words.

She's grouchy if you email her. I've emailed her a few times to ask simple questions and she replies with responses like it's not part of her job to interact with students, like it's such a bother and waste of her time. At times, her accent is difficult to understand.
Very nice teacher. Funny accent. First few days, you might be cracking up a lot ,but overall a very helpful teacher, nice teacher that actually cares about what she is doing

Mala was an excellent teacher! Even though her accent is kind of tough at times, she really knows her stuff! I would DEFINATELY take another class with her because she really cares about her students. Large lab sizes aren't her fault! I thought the labs went a long way in helping me understand stuf the text was sparse on...

she's a very sweet. she tries to be active with students. her lecture slides are easy to follow. she's fair with the midterms.. but the lab exams and the final exam were always a lot harder than the mock ones she gives us as practice.

You do not need to attend to do well. She posts all the lecture slides, and the slides are very clear and easy to follow. She is a very sweet woman, and a good biologist. Her accent is cute...sometimes a little hard to follow, but the TA's can clear up everything!

I really liked her but her accent made it hard to understand. I found that she was awesome with one on one help, but with such a huge lab size, it was hard to get that much time with her. Without that one on one help, I felt like I was drowning in terms... a little overwhelming.
heavy accent, but nice, helpful and SO FUNNY! The final was really easy.

Nice enough lady, very helpful in a one-on-one situation (like in lab), but very difficult to understand in lecture.  Quite disorganized (she usually showed up to class at least 5-10 min, she was even late to the final)  Exams were quite challenging and questions were often worded in a way that was hard to understand.
super nice, but i can not understand a word she says. her accent is very thick.

Mala, while not always organized, is an obvious expert on her subject. She has a great sense of humour, and reminds me of my grandmother (not due to age!) in that way! Her notes were great, and the exams seemed easy, but were marked hard (not marked by her though). She's a great prof, I just wish people would respect her more in-class (be quiet)!
Nice prof but lab tests and lecture final is very diffucult.  Also sometimes hard to understand her when she speaks.

This women needs to be let go. I sure she is a great biologist, just not a teacher. Her English is very poor, and she expects you to know the text back and forth. Thats fine if yur 3rd or 4th year in Biology, you should know your stuff. I wouldn't take anoughter class from her ever.
Mala is a sweet lady. However, the lab exams were very difficult, specially the second, included material that was explained in the lab very quickly. the tutorials, were not very helpful either.
She is good at explaining questions. The exams are fair and not so hard.
good teacher tests are fair, and her power points are excellent.
Tests were hard and the labs were adequate.

Her lab handouts are rough and unclear; she assumes BISC100 students being more advanced. Lab stations are scarce and are ALWAYS crowded; not all students get to participate fully due to the lack of lab stations. Inferior lab handouts, unclear speaking, and incompetent lab materials and preparation
Mala is passionate towards biology. Though, her effort doesn't show in her teachings and that is reflected in the amount of people failing her lab exams.

i cant hear what she says in class.  Combine that with the long prelab talks makes her labs boring and repetitive.  she shouldn't be teaching if she can't speak proper english.  her exams are difficult.  u gotta know almost every little details.
mala is a great instructor!  she is very smart, helpful and easy to talk to.  her accent is not that bad - don't use it as an excuse for not listening to the material!
Completely useless course, as were mala's incessantly long diatribes/prelab talks.  Could hardly understand her and when I did it still didnt make a helluva lot of sense
Super helpful and nice lab instructor.  Exams are tough though.
The exams aren't difficult if you have a brain.
Hardworking. Very organized powerpoint. Hard but fair exams.
very nice, very helpful, enthusiastic about teaching and the material. fair(and in fact relatively easy) exams. fun lab.
She tries her best to help the students and make them understand the materials, just that it is very hard to understand what she's saying with her heavy accent.
she was a great lab prof...helarious, helpful and smart. Quit whining you first years!
So nice.  Sometimes a bit hard to understand her.  She's hilarious...if you're quick enough to catch her jokes. She's great in the lab.  She loves to explain things if you ask.  She loves Biology.
Great lab!
Very easy & friendly lab instructor
No Comments
WHAT A JOKE!!!
BAD PROF very unforturate to have her. extremely hard exam.can't undastand
No Comments
Couldn't understand a single word she says..be prepared to read your text
No Comments
hard to understand unless you listen carefully, and really helpful if you do
